pageContext.claim: “We have commuted the sentence of Rod Blagojevich....It was a prosecution by the same people -- Comey, Fitzpatrick -- the same group.”
pageContext.analysis: James Comey, the FBI director fired by Trump, was not at the Justice Department or FBI when the Illinois Democrat was convicted of trying to get money for the U.S. Senate seat of Barack Obama in 2008. Comey served as Deputy Attorney General in the George W. Bush Administration. He left in 2005, and did not return to the federal government until he was chosen for FBI Director eight years later in 2013.
